Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: Draw a simple fish and label it as 'fish' (basic representation)
Add water in the drawing and label it (recognizes water as part of the habitat)
Include some plants or other living things in the habitat (attempts to show other elements in the environment)
CANNOT: Illustrate how the fish and its habitat function as part of a larger system (e.g., fish and plants' oxygen exchange) *(student isn't clear on ecosystem connections)*

Consistently label components like food, oxygen, or specific parts of the fish's habitat (e.g., lacks specific knowledge on each role of habitat elements) *(student doesn't understand or remember these roles)*
Correctly represent relationships between the fish and its habitat (e.g., might label 'fish swim in water' but not 'fish need water to live') *(student may miss key interactions)*
